{ "id": 1, "created_at": "2006-10-09T18:21:51.000Z", "created_at_i": 1160418111, "type": "story", "author": "pg", "title": "Y Combinator", "url": "http://ycombinator.com", "text": "", "points": 57, "children": [ { "id": 487171, "created_at": "2009-02-19T12:21:23.000Z", "created_at_i": 1235046083, "type": "comment", "author": "jacquesm", "text": "So, just to see how hard it is to make the longest span between article and comment :)

Congratulations on your second birthday YC, and thanks to Paul Graham for writing this forum. I had a really good look at the good a few days ago and I was quite impressed with how elegant the whole thing is put together.

Lisp would not be my language of choice for a website like this, and yet, after seeing how concise it was I'm tempted to play around with lisp in a web environment.", "points": 12, "parent_id": 1, "story_id": 1, "children": [] }, { "id": 15, "created_at": "2006-10-09T19:51:01.000Z", "created_at_i": 1160423461, "type": "comment", "author": "sama", "text": ""the rising star of venture capital" -unknown VC eating lunch on SHR", "points": 5, "parent_id": 1, "story_id": 1, "children": [ { "id": 17, "created_at": "2006-10-09T19:52:45.000Z", "created_at_i": 1160423565, "type": "comment", "author": "pg", "text": "Is there anywhere to eat on Sandhill Road?", "points": 5, "parent_id": 15, "story_id": 1, "children": [ { "id": 1079, "created_at": "2007-02-25T22:18:23.000Z", "created_at_i": nice things.", "points": 1, "parent_id": 1, "story_id": 1, "children": [] }, { "id": 234509, "created_at": "2008-07-02T20:29:48.000Z", "created_at_i": 1215030588, "type": "comment", "author": "kleevr", "text": "sequential numbering\n I must be bored", "points": 1, "parent_id": 1, "story_id": 1, "children": [ { "id": 234621, "created_at": "2008-07-02T22:10:58.000Z", "created_at_i": 1215036658, "type": "comment", "author": "kleevr", "text": "I guess that news.yc is 1-indexed :)

http://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=0 , DNE", "points": 6, "parent_id": 234509, "story_id": 1, "children": [] }, { "id": 234560, "created_at": "2008-07-02T21:20:36.000Z", "created_at_i": 1215033636, "type": "comment", "author": "sebg", "text": "Interesting - post 1 has comments. no more comments until post 15. which then has the same conversation between pg and dnom as the first post. To top it off, post 17 is the conversation in posts 1 and 15.", "points": 2, "parent_id": 234509, "story_id": 1, "children": [ { "id": 234568, "created_at": "2008-07-02T21:24:27.000Z", "created_at_i": 1215033867, "type": "comment", "author": "byrneseyeview", "text": "I think those 'items' are comments, not posts.", "points": 1, "parent_id": 234560, "story_id": 1, "children": [ { "id": 234633, "created_at": "2008-07-02T22:22:09.000Z", "created_at_i": 1215037329, "type": "comment", "author": "kleevr", "text": "items: comments || posts... \nthey're also arranged in a hierarchy...", "points": 1, "parent_id": 234568, "story_id": 1, "children": [] } ] }, { "id": 234593, "created_at": "2008-07-02T21:47:18.000Z", "created_at_i": 1215035238, "type": "comment", "author": "kleevr", "text": "I'm sure the first fifteen were used primarily to populate the burgeoning news.yc", "points": 1, "parent_id": 234560, "story_id": 1, "children": [] } ] }, { "id": 234548, "created_at": "2008-07-02T21:09:38.000Z", "created_at_i": 1215032978, "type": "comment", "author": "byrneseyeview", "text": "I think I agree?", "points": 1, "parent_id": 234509, "story_id": 1, "children": [ { "id": 2, "parent_id": 234548, "story_id": 1, "children": [ { "id": 234551, "created_at": "2008-07-02T21:13:37.000Z", "created_at_i": 1215033217, "type": "comment", "author": "byrneseyeview", "text": "How many people are lurking on this thread?", "points": 1, "parent_id": 234549, "story_id": 1, "children": [ { "id": 234567, "created_at": "2008-07-02T21:24:23.000Z", "created_at_i": 1215033863, "type": "created_at_i": 1215034508, "type": "comment", "author": "sebg", "text": "ditto. (thanks for pointing out posts vs. items.)", "points": 1, "parent_id": 234567, "story_id": 1, "children": [] } ] } ] } ] } ] } ] } ] }

{ "hits": [ { "created_at": "2014-04-13T00:49:41.000Z", "title": "HMO: Now a repo to post too...", "url": "", "author": "Prefinem", "points": 1, "story_text": "I saw a post here: https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=7572911 about creating a Help Me Out system... I figured it would be easier for people if instead of a grouped up posts, that may never get to the home page, if there was an actual site to post HMO's... And what better way to manage that than with a repo....

So, I spun up something that you can see here: http://prefinem.github.io/HelpMeOut/. You can create an HMO by making a pull request to https://github.com/Prefinem/HelpMeOut using Jekyll's posts. Posts are searchable by title and tags (meta data from the post) and are discover-able under categories (assuming you put a category in your post that exists on the site)

If you want a new category, you can send me an email (on the site), post here, or make a pull request.", "comment_text": null, "num_comments": 0, "story_id": null, "story_title": null, "story_url": null, "parent_id": null, "created_at_i": 1397350181, "_tags": [ "story", "author_Prefinem", "story_7579750" ], "objectID": "7579750", "_highlightResult": { "title": { "value": "HMO: Now a repo to post too...", "matchLevel": "none", "matchedWords": [] }, "url": { "value": "", "matchLevel": "none", "matchedWords": [] }, "author": { "value": "Prefinem", "matchLevel": "none", "matchedWords": [] }, "story_text": { "value": "I saw a post here: https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=7572911 about creating a Help Me Out system... I figured it would be easier for people if instead of a grouped up posts, that may never get to the home page, if there was an actual site to post HMO's... And what better way to manage that than with a repo....

So, I spun up something that you can see here: http://prefinem.github.io/HelpMeOut/. You can create an HMO by making a pull request to https://github.com/Prefinem/HelpMeOut using Jekyll's posts. Posts are searchable by title and tags (meta data from the post) and are discover-able under categories (assuming you put a category in your post that exists on the site)

If you want a new category, you can send me an email (on the site), post here, or make a pull request.", "matchLevel": "none", "matchedWords": [] } } }, { "created_at": "2014-04-13T00:42:20.000Z", "2014-04-13T00:11:55.000Z", "title": "Ask HN: how did successful companies got started out?", "url": "", "author": "humpbaq", "points": 1, "story_text": "Hey HN, can we compile a list of documentaries/articles/whatnot of companies that got started, especially in their very early stage. What marketing tactics they used, how they hired their key people, how their product evolved, etc. I think it would be really interesting to go through them and draw inspirations for our little startup someday.\\nThanks!", "comment_text": null, "num_comments": 0, "story_id": null, "story_title": null, "story_url": null, "parent_id": null, "created_at_i": 1397347915, "_tags": [ "story", "author_humpbaq", "story_7579664", "ask_hn" ], "objectID": "7579664", "_highlightResult": { "title": { "value": "Ask HN: how did successful companies got started out?", "matchLevel": "none", "matchedWords": [] }, "url": { "value": "", "matchLevel": "none", "matchedWords": [] }, "author": { "value": "humpbaq", "matchLevel": "none", "matchedWords": [] }, "story_text": { "value": "Hey HN, can we compile a list of documentaries/articles/whatnot of companies that got started, especially in their very early stage. What marketing tactics they used, how they hired their key people, how their product evolved, etc. I think it would be really interesting to go through them and draw inspirations for our little startup someday.\\nThanks!", "matchLevel": "none", "matchedWords": [] } } }, { "created_at": "2014-04-13T00:10:50.000Z", "title": " Private crypto keys are accessible to Heartbleed hackers, new data shows", "url": "http://arstechnica.com/security/2014/04/private-crypto-keys-are-accessible-to-heartbleed-hackers-new-data-shows/", "author": "lisper", "points": 1, "story_text": "", "comment_text": null, "num_comments": 0, "story_id": null, "story_title": null, "story_url": null, "parent_id": null, "created_at_i": 1397347850, "_tags": [ "story", "author_lisper", "story_7579662" ], "objectID": "7579662", "_highlightResult": { "title": { "value": " Private crypto keys are accessible to Heartbleed hackers, new data shows", "matchLevel": "none", "matchedWords": [] }, "url": { "value": "http://arstechnica.com/security/2014/04/private-crypto-keys-are-accessible-to-heartbleed-hackers-new-data-shows/", "matchLevel": "none", "matchedWords": [] }, "author": { "value": "lisper", "matchLevel": "none", "matchedWords": [] }, "story_text": { "value": "", "matchLevel": "none", "matchedWords": [] } } }, { "created_at": "2014-04-13T00:10:38.000Z", "title": "Ask HN: Why do you do what you do?", "url": "", "author": "splatzone", "points": 1, "story_text": "I thought I loved web development, but recently I feel like I’ve plateaued. I’m not wealthy, and now it feels like I’m working just to survive, not out of some divine passion. It scares me because I’ve recently turned twenty and I feel I need to start making some decisions.

This got me thinking about all the other people on HN. I know some people here can be very evangelical about their work publicly, but I want to know the true reasons people here do what they do.

Do you work to survive?

Do you genuinely think you’re changing the world?

Do you just love what you do?

I think knowing about other people's situations will help me a lot. Thanks.", "comment_text": null, "num_comments": 0, "story_id": null, "story_title": null, "story_url": null, "parent_id": null, "created_at_i": 1397347838, "_tags": [ "story", "author_splatzone", "story_7579661", "ask_hn" ], "objectID": "7579661", "_highlightResult": { "title": { "value": "Ask HN: Why do you do what you do?", "matchLevel": "none", "matchedWords": [] }, "url": { "value": "", "matchLevel": "none", "matchedWords": [] }, "author": { "value": "splatzone", "matchLevel": "none", "matchedWords": [] }, "story_text": { "value": "I thought I loved web development, but recently I feel like I’ve plateaued. I’m not wealthy, and now it feels like I’m working just to survive, not out of some divine passion. It scares me because I’ve recently turned twenty and I feel I need to start making some decisions.

This got me thinking about all the other people on HN. I know some people here can be very evangelical about their work publicly, but I want to know the true reasons people here do what they do.

Do you work to survive?

Do you genuinely think you’re changing the world?

Do you just love what you do?

I think knowing about other people's situations will help me a lot. Thanks.", "matchLevel": "none", "matchedWords": [] } } }, { "created_at": "2014-04-13T00:08:14.000Z", "title": " Nanosecond Scale Remote Timing Attacks On PHP Applications", "url": { "id": 1, "created_at": "2006-10-09T18:21:51.000Z", "created_at_i": 1160418111, "type": "story", "author": "pg", "title": "Y Combinator", "url": "http://ycombinator.com", "text": "", "points": 57, "children": [ { "id": 487171, "created_at": "2009-02-19T12:21:23.000Z", "created_at_i": 1235046083, "type": "comment", "author": "jacquesm", "text": "So, just to see how hard it is to make the longest span between article and comment :)

Congratulations on your second birthday YC, and thanks to Paul Graham for writing this forum. I had a really good look at the good a few days ago and I was quite impressed with how elegant the whole thing is put together.

Lisp would not be my language of choice for a website like this, and yet, after seeing how concise it was I'm tempted to play around with lisp in a web environment.", "points": 12, "parent_id": 1, "story_id": 1, "children": [] }, { "id": 15, "created_at": "2006-10-09T19:51:01.000Z", "created_at_i": 1160423461, "type": "comment", "author": "sama", "text": ""the rising star of venture capital" { "hits": [ { "created_at": "2014-04-13T00:49:41.000Z", "title": "HMO: Now a repo to post too...", "url": "", "author": "Prefinem", "points": 1, "story_text": "I saw a post here: https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=7572911 about creating a Help Me Out system... I figured it would be easier for people if instead of a grouped up posts, that may never get to the home page, if there was an actual site to post HMO's... And what better way to manage that than with a repo....

So, I spun up something that you can see here: http://prefinem.github.io/HelpMeOut/. You can create an HMO by making a pull request to https://github.com/Prefinem/HelpMeOut using Jekyll's posts. Posts are searchable by title and tags (meta data from the post) and are discover-able under categories (assuming you put a category in your post that exists on the site)

If you want a new category, you can send me an email (on the site), post here, or make a pull request.", "comment_text": null, "num_comments": 0, "story_id": null, "story_title": null, "story_url": null, "parent_id": null, "created_at_i": 1397350181, "_tags": [ "story", "author_Prefinem", "story_7579750" ], "objectID": "7579750", "_highlightResult": { "title": { "value": "HMO: Now a repo to post too...", "matchLevel": "none", "matchedWords": [] }, "url": { "value": "", "matchLevel": "none", "matchedWords": [] }, "author": { "value": "Prefinem", "matchLevel": "none", "matchedWords": [] }, "story_text": { "value": "I saw a post here: https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=7572911 about creating a Help Me Out system... I figured it would be easier for people if instead of a grouped up posts, that may never get to the home page, if there was an actual site to post HMO's... And what better way to manage that than with a repo....

So, I spun up something that you can see here: http://prefinem.github.io/HelpMeOut/. You can create an HMO by making a pull request to https://github.com/Prefinem/HelpMeOut using Jekyll's posts. Posts are searchable by title and tags (meta data from the post) and are discover-able under categories (assuming you put a category in your post that exists on the site)

If you want a new category, you can send me an email (on the site), post here, or make a pull request.", "matchLevel": "none", "matchedWords": [] } } }, { "created_at": "2014-04-13T00:42:20.000Z", "2014-04-13T00:11:55.000Z", "title": "Ask HN: how did successful companies got started out?", "url": "", "author": "humpbaq", "points": 1, "story_text": "Hey HN, can we compile a list of documentaries/articles/whatnot of companies that got started, especially in their very early stage. What marketing tactics they used, how they hired their key people, how their product evolved, etc. I think it would be really interesting to go through them and draw inspirations for our little startup someday.\\nThanks!", "comment_text": null, "num_comments": 0, "story_id": null, "story_title": null, "story_url": null, "parent_id": null, "created_at_i": 1397347915, "_tags": [ "story", "author_humpbaq", "story_7579664", "ask_hn" ], "objectID": "7579664", "_highlightResult": { "title": { "value": "Ask HN: how did successful companies got started out?", "matchLevel": "none", "matchedWords": [] }, "url": { "value": "", "matchLevel": "none", "matchedWords": [] }, "author": { "value": "humpbaq", "matchLevel": "none", "matchedWords": [] }, "story_text": { "value": "Hey HN, can we compile a list of documentaries/articles/whatnot of companies that got started, especially in their very early stage. What marketing tactics they used, how they hired their key people, how their product evolved, etc. I think it would be really interesting to go through them and draw inspirations for our little startup someday.\\nThanks!", "matchLevel": "none", "matchedWords": [] } } }, { "created_at": "2014-04-13T00:10:50.000Z", "title": " Private crypto keys are accessible to Heartbleed hackers, new data shows", "url": "http://arstechnica.com/security/2014/04/private-crypto-keys-are-accessible-to-heartbleed-hackers-new-data-shows/", "author": "lisper", "points": 1, "story_text": "", "comment_text": null, "num_comments": 0, "story_id": null, "story_title": null, "story_url": null, "parent_id": null, "created_at_i": 1397347850, "_tags": [ "story", "author_lisper", "story_7579662" ], "objectID": "7579662", "_highlightResult": { "title": { "value": " Private crypto keys are accessible to Heartbleed hackers, new data shows", "matchLevel": "none", "matchedWords": [] }, "url": { "value": "http://arstechnica.com/security/2014/04/private-crypto-keys-are-accessible-to-heartbleed-hackers-new-data-shows/", "matchLevel": "none", "matchedWords": [] }, "author": { "value": "lisper", "matchLevel": "none", "matchedWords": [] }, "story_text": { "value": "", "matchLevel": "none", "matchedWords": [] } } }, { "created_at": "2014-04-13T00:10:38.000Z", "title": "Ask HN: Why do you do what you do?", "url": "", "author": "splatzone", "points": 1, "story_text": "I thought I loved web development, but recently I feel like I’ve plateaued. I’m not wealthy, and now it feels like I’m working just to survive, not out of some divine passion. It scares me because I’ve recently turned twenty and I feel I need to start making some decisions.

This got me thinking about all the other people on HN. I know some people here can be very evangelical about their work publicly, but I want to know the true reasons people here do what they do.

Do you work to survive?

Do you genuinely think you’re changing the world?

Do you just love what you do?

I think knowing about other people's situations will help me a lot. Thanks.", "comment_text": null, "num_comments": 0, "story_id": null, "story_title": null, "story_url": null, "parent_id": null, "created_at_i": 1397347838, "_tags": [ "story", "author_splatzone", "story_7579661", "ask_hn" ], "objectID": "7579661", "_highlightResult": { "title": { "value": "Ask HN: Why do you do what you do?", "matchLevel": "none", "matchedWords": [] }, "url": { "value": "", "matchLevel": "none", "matchedWords": [] }, "author": { "value": "splatzone", "matchLevel": "none", "matchedWords": [] }, "story_text": { "value": "I thought I loved web development, but recently I feel like I’ve plateaued. I’m not wealthy, and now it feels like I’m working just to survive, not out of some divine passion. It scares me because I’ve recently turned twenty and I feel I need to start making some decisions.

This got me thinking about all the other people on HN. I know some people here can be very evangelical about their work publicly, but I want to know the true reasons people here do what they do.

Do you work to survive?

Do you genuinely think you’re changing the world?

Do you just love what you do?

I think knowing about other people's situations will help me a lot. description: This API is built on top of Algolia Search's API. It enables developers to access HN (Hacker News) data programmatically using a REST API. This documentation describes how to request data from the API and how to interpret the response.
name: v1
